name: Kepler-42
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-42 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-42 is a star with 0.13 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.17 times its radius. It is located 126.22 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-42 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-42 system


Kepler-42 b

Kepler-42 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of Kepler-42 b is 0.78 that of Earth.


Kepler-42 c

Kepler-42 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of Kepler-42 c is 0.73 that of Earth.


Kepler-42 d

Kepler-42 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of Kepler-42 d is 0.57 that of Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-42, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
